alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Pickaway (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 9:14PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN AND NORTHEASTERN PICKAWAY COUNTIES THROUGH 945 PM EDT... At 914 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Grove City, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Grove City, Circleville, Canal Winchester, Groveport, Ashville, South Bloomfield, Obetz, Commercial Point, Lithopolis, Urbancrest, Orient, Lockbourne, Aw Marion State Park, East Ringgold, Duvall, Slate Run Metro Park and State Route 674 at State Route 188. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 94 and 103. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
